title_review: Great find on the back streets of Madrid
review_preview: We stayed at the Urban Hotel in Madrid for 4 nights & we were desperate to find a really good restaurant that wasn't the usual run of the mill tapas which you seem to find in Santa Ana just round the corner.  Our receptionist recommended...
review_full: We stayed at the Urban Hotel in Madrid for 4 nights & we were desperate to find a really good restaurant that wasn't the usual run of the mill tapas which you seem to find in Santa Ana just round the corner. Our receptionist recommended this Argentinian restaurant & we were not disappointed. On arrival we were asked if we had a reservation by which we replied no (it was a rainy Sunday night & the place only had one other couple currently dining), the waitress then just disappeared before reappearing & guiding us to a table without uttering another word (or smile). The food here was just great - the steak excellent, nice fries & fresh salad/bread. The waitresses did have a snotty nosed approach to dealing with you as if you were an inconvenience to them having to serve you. That was a shame as otherwise the place couldn't really be faulted. Good food, good wine, nice ambience just horrible sour-faced waitressing. Would recommend if you want a change from the Spanish cuisine but don't expect any smiles (even when you pay!).

review_preview: A very pleasant experience. First, there are only 8-10 tables so you absolutely must have a reservation. From the outside it doesn't really distinguish itself from many other bistros or small restaurants. BUT , this was highly recommended by the concierge staff at The Westin...
review_full: A very pleasant experience. First, there are only 8-10 tables so you absolutely must have a reservation. From the outside it doesn't really distinguish itself from many other bistros or small restaurants. BUT , this was highly recommended by the concierge staff at The Westin Palace Hotel and they were absolutely correct.  Inside, it is clearly a bistro in its appearance. Not fancy, just very pleasant. HOWEVER, the highlights are 1)the waitstaff who were some of the most pleasant people we have met and 2) the food. First, one can trust everything that the waitstaff tells you about each item as well as the wine. We had an outstanding tomato salad and a marinated salmon for appetizers. We both chose the same main course, the cannelloni with veal cheeks. The wine from Ribera Del Duerro region was Kairn (?spelling). Everything was OUTSTANDING. It was a welcome change from some of the more formal and more expensive restaurants. The price of the meal was extremely reasonable---about 60% less than some of the fancy restaurants.  Lastly, how good is it? It's the restaurant that concierge staff from The Westin goes to for their Christmas lunch every year. You can't help but love the experience.

So always a good sign.  Can't wait to go back!

review_preview: Our party of 4 visiting Madrid was one hour late for our booking, due to delays driving into Madrid from France. We were so happy that they managed to accommodate us even though it was a busy Friday night. Not knowing what to expect, and...
review_full: Our party of 4 visiting Madrid was one hour late for our booking, due to delays driving into Madrid from France. We were so happy that they managed to accommodate us even though it was a busy Friday night. Not knowing what to expect, and the fit out of the small restaurant was casual, we were totally blown away by the creative and high quality gourmet food, at such reasonable prices. We enjoyed the crispy wontons, grilled octopus, the thai curry style fish and black noodles, mellow rice. The mellow rice has amazing rich flavour ( a truffle fan), but I think the saltiness can be dialled down a little. We are very impressed with the chef's talent. The service staff were friendly and helpful. We were surprised to find out that it has only been opened for about 6 months, already it is very popular as they had to turn away people at the door. A highlight of our stay in Madrid.

title_review: Slice of Heaven (with a hint of truffle)

review_full: We just had our New Year's lunch in Pizzateca and both kids and adults had a great culinary experience. We had to wait a bit for the restaurant to open at 1:30pm, but it was very worth it. The pizzas are prepared by a friendly owner with a variety of fresh local ingredients. We tasted egg-plant, truffle, Spanish jamon and goat cheese with balsamic reduction containing pizzas. Absolutely spectac! Only thing missing was a glass or two of California Chardonnay or New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc to round off the taste sensation. The restaurant is very tiny, with only a couple chairs, so taking pizza to go is also a great option. Prices extremely reasonable at 6eur for 2 generous pieces and a drink.  I second another reviewer's comment: the best pizza in Spain after living here for 2 years. If you do not need comfort and only care about quality, this is a must.

Also, as a side note, the guy working at the time was very friendly and just seemed like a genuinely nice person.

When we commented to the owner that his pizzas are among the best we ever tasted, he was totally modest and said his home town of Napoli has better ones (ok our next culinary destination). The place is really small with only a few seats, but people tend to eat quickly and move on to free up space. Sit or take away, you have to try his pizzas when in Madrid!

review_preview: This small restaurant is situated a short distance away from the down-town area but it is absolutely worth visiting.I arrived pretty soon after evening opening – so I was the only customer for a while. This gave me the opportunity to talk with the...
review_full: This small restaurant is situated a short distance away from the down-town area but it is absolutely worth visiting. I arrived pretty soon after evening opening – so I was the only customer for a while. This gave me the opportunity to talk with the owner and hear about his experiences, ideas and goals how to develop his restaurant. Now he is very committed to local producers, not only with food raw materiels but also with vines. The Market offers excellent courses. After their kitchens´ greeting I had ”Green Beans Salad, Mango, Bacon and Cava Foam”, which was not only tasty but also visually great. As my main I had “Sierra de Guadarrama” Grilled Veal Loin, Muhammara and Padron Peppers”, which also was delicious. Also the vines selected for my courses suited very well together with them.  As a final ”Mascarpone Panna Cotta with Roasted Quince Cream and Yogurt Ice Cream” topped my excellent dinner.  All in all I was very satisfied with my dinner, courses were well prepared, service was casual and friendly and last but not least, the prices were very acceptable.

The food itself was simply superb and all the dishes we sampled were well cooked, beautifully presented and exceedingly good. Most dishes come as half or full portions and this was absolutely perfect for lunch. Lastly we all felt that given the quality of the food and the service the price was very reasonable.  I would advise booking in advance as the restaurant is fairly small and will become even more popular given the positive reviews it receives. The Market is not in the centre of Madrid but is easily reached by a short and very worthwhile metro trip.  Highly recommended

title_review: Hidden Gem in the Heart of Madrid.
review_preview: Our server was lovely. I forgot her name but she was from Venezuela, super friendly and courteous. We had wonton to start and it was delicious. Nice and crispy as described yet full of juicy flavour. For main I had the gnocchi and my partner...
review_full: Our server was lovely. I forgot her name but she was from Venezuela, super friendly and courteous.  We had wonton to start and it was delicious. Nice and crispy as described yet full of juicy flavour.  For main I had the gnocchi and my partner had Pekin Chicken. Both were also delicious. Can you see the running theme? I might say that the main was saltier than my usual taste, however I did notice that in Madrid this tends to be the case.  For dessert we had the banabrûlée which was another testament to the creativity of the chef. To our surprise this portion was bigger than the last two.  The drinks and food were both really reasonably price for the quality and I'd definitely recommend booking a table if you were in Madrid.  If you're looking for a decent meal, you won't be dissatisfied.

review_full: We had the house salad with goat cheese. Dressing was a simple olive oil and balsamic; it was perfect and fed four adults- my wife and I, and two early twenty somethings. For pizza we had the mushroom with truffle oil, and goat cheese and bufalina. It’s just food, I know, but the whole meal captured what food and eating, especially with ones family on holiday, should be. It was so satisfying.The crust of the pizza was like an academy award nominee for best-supporting actor; it was so remarkable, but it didn’t upstage the stars of both pizzas, the excellent toppings. I’m sorry we’re leaving Madrid tomorrow because I’d go back again for lunch tomorrow.

title_review: Excellent seasonal food in great atmosphere!

We shared two starters, two entrees and a dessert; everything was wonderful. Furthermore, they have a great wine selection and our waiter recommended a very nice bottle. The personnel is attentive and very effective. I strongly recommend this restaurant, the menu is Spanish traditional, seasonal with an original touch. Less than 50€ in total; definitely, a great choice.

review_preview: Simple decor and a lovely, relaxed atmosphere. Interesting wooden artworks made by the owner from recycled wood from ships. The food: the pizza was perfect. Two of us shared a La Zuccona with pumpkin, smoked provolone and generous ribbons of ham. The crust was thin...
review_full: Simple decor and a lovely, relaxed atmosphere. Interesting wooden artworks made by the owner from recycled wood from ships.  The food: the pizza was perfect. Two of us shared a La Zuccona with pumpkin, smoked provolone and generous ribbons of ham. The crust was thin and crispy and the toppings moist and flavorful. Molto delicioso. The star however was the gelato - chocolate and pistachio. This gelato is better than any we have eaten anywhere, including Italy. The first mouthful had our eyes popping. We looked at each other, dived in for seconds and our dreams were realized - incredible gelato. Our waiter confirmed it is an artisan gelato.  The food was exceptional. Our waiter and the owner were relaxed and friendly. We will be back.

The owner greeted us outside the restaurant and from that moment on was attentive, polite, interesting, knowledgeable and charming. This is a small restaurant and there is a nice mix of clients, from young Spaniards to older English people. It is casual and bright and cheerful. The menu is limited (which I believe helps maintain quality and freshness) and the food is delicious. The wine that the boss chose for us is now on my list of "to buy". We will definitely return when we go back to Madrid.

review_preview: We went to The Market Madrid in May 2014 following some good reviews on tripadvisor. We were not dissappointed, on the contrary, we were completely blown away. The service was excellent and the food was even better. The menu was very inventive and we took...
review_full: We went to The Market Madrid in May 2014 following some good reviews on tripadvisor. We were not dissappointed, on the contrary, we were completely blown away. The service was excellent and the food was even better. The menu was very inventive and we took an adventure and ordered the most bizarre options that the restaurant offered - everything was spectacular: The starters were excellent and really opened our appetite. The main courses were perfectly cooked and seasoned and offered the perfect portion to leave room for dessert. Finally, the desserts were fabulous even though on the menu they seemed kind of odd, one of them had sweet basil pesto and a sweet cherry tomatoe. We were offered a Spanish red wine "Iuvene" that we afterwards searched in several stores - unfortunately we didn't find it, but it was great and highlighted the different tastes of the food. Going to "The Market Madrid" was the highlight of our vacation and we were sad that we didn't stay longer in Madrid to be able to return.

title_review: Put this restaurant on your Madrid “must do” list
review_preview: After touring Spain for 3 weeks, we returned to Madrid before heading home and stopped at The Market Madrid for our last lunch. It was outstanding! Owners, Jaime and Norma remembered us from our first visit and welcomed us warmly. Jaime even left the restaurant...
review_full: After touring Spain for 3 weeks, we returned to Madrid before heading home and stopped at The Market Madrid for our last lunch. It was outstanding! Owners, Jaime and Norma remembered us from our first visit and welcomed us warmly. Jaime even left the restaurant for 5 minutes to help us coax a parking ticket from a nearby meter. The menu changes frequently based on market availability so we had a new set of tempting choices which Jaime explained to ensure we understood each item. The gals opted for two medio portions each while the men chose medio starters and full entrées. All choices were excellent. We decided this time to also have dessert. I cannot say enough about how excellent this restaurant is, so good that we were trying to convince Jaime and Norma to return to Seattle where they lived a few years ago. The four of us live in British Columbia and would gladly find an excuse to visit Seattle to go to this restaurant. Madrid, you don’t know how lucky you are!

review_full: My partner is a meat lover and after much searching, I was able to find this beautiful restaurant. Andres the waiter was spectacular with us, and according to my partner, he ate the best Solomillo of his life. I ate chicken and its preparation was optimal. I will like to point out that, in our reservation was specified that it was for a Bday celebration, and unfortunately the restaurant did not do any detail for my partner, which is the first time, usually in other places they offer a dessert or even a simple "Happy birthday". They have to have better follow up on those of the "Special occasions" as Customer Service. But as for the product, service price, I thought it was right, as we ordered a bottle of wine, a salad to share (they are quite nice) a Burrata with Pomodorini very good, and Empanada Argentina, he ate the Solomillo and I chicken with a garnish of vegetables (enough for 2) and an Argentinian brownie ... oh and bread. The attentive service, the atmosphere of a very quiet place and the food quite good. Is a place to visit and if we are in Madrid again, we will go.

review_preview: I absolutely loved this place! It's small (so be sure to reserve) and not exactly in the center of town, but definitely worth the cab ride to get there. Our friends reserved there for a birthday dinner and I'm so glad they did! The menu...
review_full: I absolutely loved this place! It's small (so be sure to reserve) and not exactly in the center of town, but definitely worth the cab ride to get there. Our friends reserved there for a birthday dinner and I'm so glad they did!  The menu is short so very easy to navigate. Our waiter spoke flawless English and explained every dish. I had the brandade de bacalao, which won me over immediately: fluffy creamed cod piped into thick rounds of bread. One of my friends got the blood-sausage ravioli, which was an explosion of flavor. Then I had the pork cheeks with a mole sauce: the tenderest meat and fabulous spices. The prices are very affordable for a restaurant of this quality. The restaurant also offers half portions for appetizers as well as main courses. The wine list is very good and also affordable. For dessert, since it was my friend's birthday, the chef came out with something special: a basil poundcake with candied cherry tomatoes. Sounds weird, but it totally works! This restaurant is on my list for my next trip back to beautiful Madrid!

review_preview: There was a big trade show in Madrid and I had to arrange business dinners during the show. I saw this restaurant receiving good reviews, but was not very sure if this place was suitable for a business dinner. In particular, the client we wanted...
review_full: There was a big trade show in Madrid and I had to arrange business dinners during the show.  I saw this restaurant receiving good reviews, but was not very sure if this place was suitable for a business dinner. In particular, the client we wanted to take to this restaurant was known as a gourmet. I went to the restaurant a few days before the dinner to confirm my booking and its location. I was not a guest on that date however, the owner was very politely serving me and explained the restaurant/menus. The restaurant was smaller than I thought but I had confidence that our client would be amazed. The dining was amazing. This was due to not only food but also hospitality. The owner was so friendly and dedicated to customers including us. This is because the restaurant accepts a small number of guests and the staff are closer to customers. All of us were very satisfied. We tried four other restaurants during our stay in Madrid, this was the best with no doubt. Thanks again and see you soon!

My husband and I highly recommend you head out of the touristy areas and make the trip here.

We had a bottle of white wine, but didn’t have deserts. The total bill came to €85 for 2 people.

review_preview: For me, a great dining experience is a blend of amazing food, good service, ambiance and a little surprise thrown in. We had been walking quite a bit and were looking for a spot on our way back to the hotel. Searching Trip Advisor, I...
review_full: For me, a great dining experience is a blend of amazing food, good service, ambiance and a little surprise thrown in. We had been walking quite a bit and were looking for a spot on our way back to the hotel. Searching Trip Advisor, I found a place that looked to fit the bill. Though we were starting to wonder a bit as we walked thru a pretty dicey part of Madrid and down a small alley that didn’t bode too well. [Oddly enough, this is ½ a block from Taste of the US, apparently the only place you can get Pop Tarts, Twinkies, cranberry sauce and pumpkin pie filling.] We walked past it at first, then noticed the nice awning outclassed anything else on the street so we went in. The service was top notch, and the food was also – creative, different, fresh, wonderful. It reminded us a bit of Uchi in Austin – combinations of food you might not expect, but that work together incredibly well. Everything we tried was amazing, all washed down by a nice Albarino. We had the place mostly to ourselves – it was just the oasis we were looking for with surprisingly amazing food on top. Beware though – it’s not cheap.

review_preview: I had read great things about this restaurant and was not disappointed. Having made a reservation, we were nearly an hour late but when we called they were totally understanding and still had a table for us. The food is creative and really delicious. The...
review_full: I had read great things about this restaurant and was not disappointed. Having made a reservation, we were nearly an hour late but when we called they were totally understanding and still had a table for us. The food is creative and really delicious. The starters are all available in two sizes meaning that even if there are only two of you can share and try a lot of the dishes. We also shared one of the main meals (gnochi and lamb ragu) which was amazing. The waiters/owner comes and explains each dish when they deliver it to your table which is a nice touch and are all really friendly. I would say they are Michelin star quality. For the quality of the food, the prices are also excellent. Just wished they had one where I live in the South of Spain! Muchisimas gracias a todos!

review_preview: We found this place here at Tripadvisor and decided to give it a try due to all the good reviews. And we did not regret it! After a long morning in Madrid, this is the spot for some delicious, home-made tasting like pizzas. We went...
review_full: We found this place here at Tripadvisor and decided to give it a try due to all the good reviews. And we did not regret it! After a long morning in Madrid, this is the spot for some delicious, home-made tasting like pizzas. We went for the special menu, two pieces and a drink for 6€, which is quite a good value for money option, because we did not leave hungry! Separately, each piece is 2,50€. But there's also the round pizza to go option for 7€.  At the moment, there were truffles & mushroom, marguerita, spanish ham and fresh mozzarella pizzas to choose from. The staff is quite nice. Too bad there's isn't much space, only 4 seats, although we were lucky and it was empty! A good place to stop for a tasty bite in busy (and most of the times) over-priced Madrid!

review_preview: An Argetian restaurant in Madrid, the grill is on the left hand side as you go in and the meats are on display in a refrigerated cabinet visible from the street.I have been here several times and tend to order the same, to start...
review_full: An Argetian restaurant in Madrid, the grill is on the left hand side as you go in and the meats are on display in a refrigerated cabinet visible from the street. I have been here several times and tend to order the same, to start a chorizo criollo (which is a white sausage not typical spanish chorizo) but nicely spiced and great off the grill, and an empanadilla. Then I gor for a lomo alto (sirloin steak) which are always thick and juicy and a patata a la brasa which is a baked potato put on the grill. The house wine in Puerta Vieja Rioja which is quite nice. Starters mentioned are 3 to 4 euros not expensive but quite small, steak about 17 euros. Delicious tender meat. Decoration is ok, nothing fancy and the waitresses are friendly.

review_preview: If you are ever in Madrid and you are in deep need for a good steak, I recommend you visit the argentinean steakhouse "La Cabaña Argentina". It's located in the old part of the city, near Sol, and it's one of the best steakhouses in...
review_full: If you are ever in Madrid and you are in deep need for a good steak, I recommend you visit the argentinean steakhouse "La Cabaña Argentina". It's located in the old part of the city, near Sol, and it's one of the best steakhouses in town, in my humble opinion. This restaurant is specifically located in "Ventura de la Vega" street, which is known as "the street of taste" (La Calle del Sabor, http://www.callesabor.es). The exact address is "Ventura de la Vega, 10" in Madrid.  It's owned and managed by argentineans, and I can confirm that the meat is prepared in the argentinean style of the "Parrilla". Most of the different steak options are very good and i prefer the "Bife Lomo Bajo". One of the most interest things is that you can even taste some of the argentinean specialties like "Molleja" (Sweetbread), which is quite difficult to find in this kind of restaurants in Europe. The area is surrounded by other restaurants and pubs so you can go out after finishing dinner, if you are able to walk after eating a regular argentinean steak of more than 400 grams.  If you are planning to go to this restaurant on a weekend night, i recommend you make a reservation because it would be full otherwise. However, the place is spacious enough so even if it's full, you can have a nice and quite evening.

review_preview: Very rarely so you find a chef who can cook a steak perfectly. I am always attracted to a restaurant with an open kitchen, there's something enticing about seeing your food and how it's prepared, the aromas as it cooks and the care a chef...
review_full: Very rarely so you find a chef who can cook a steak perfectly. I am always attracted to a restaurant with an open kitchen, there's something enticing about seeing your food and how it's prepared, the aromas as it cooks and the care a chef takes to produce a great meal.  This restaurant is situated around the corner from our hotel 'Suite Prado' and we chose this place to splash-out during our visit. Prime cuts cooked however you want them. I recommend medium, which is medium rare elsewhere. Pink in the middle and seared to lock in all of the flavours. Staff are inviting, not sure where the other reviewers got the idea that the waiting staff are rude, but I guess everyone can have an off day. The service style is quite traditional, different servers to tak the order, deliver and clear away. They tend to leave you alone and aren't over-friendly which might not be good for everyone. Personally I like a relaxed style of service.  My tips ... A starter is enough for two, so consider sharing.  Order a bottle of reserve Rioja to accompany your steak.  Sides aren't automatically provided. Choose some starch and vegetables/salad but again this is big enough to be shared.  Don't order chicken. Steak or nothing! Hope you enjoy and found this review helpful. I'm dribbling at the thought of going back there. I'm trying their sister restaurant tonight for an authentic paella. Buen Apetito

review_preview: Need to preface this with the following: I'm half Argentine -- the half that loves cows that are lovingly grass fed in the Pampas and get to soak up the sun. La Cabaña is the second best Argentine steakhouse I've been in my LIFE.If...
review_full: Need to preface this with the following: I'm half Argentine -- the half that loves cows that are lovingly grass fed in the Pampas and get to soak up the sun. La Cabaña is the second best Argentine steakhouse I've been in my LIFE. If you're curious, my number one favorite is in Buenos Aires (La Brigada, get the entraña al punto). But I digress. La Cabaña's entraña al punto is the kind of meal I'll remember fondly years from now--just as I've salivated over memories of my dinner at La Brigada. Located walking distance from Plaza de Santa Ana, we got there at 9PM, which we thought was late enough. Dinner doesn't usually start until 11PM in Madrid, so bring the TUMS. By 10PM the restaurant was completely full (on a weekday), so reservations are recommended. It's so rare to get a steak so perfectly executed that it requires no salt, sauce, bread or fixings. Argentine steak is typically served at a perfect pink medium (al punto) with a crispy crust and mega moist middle. Our steaks were served on a communal platter that arrived sizzling and could have easily served 3-4. I said could have. We had no problems devouring it--every bite coupled with a head shake and close of the eyes to soak in the experience.

review_preview: Although this restaurant is a little tucked away in a suburb of Madrid it is well worth searching out.  It is small and very popular, so booking is recommended.  The food is excellent, being based on what is fresh in the market at the time,...
review_full: Although this restaurant is a little tucked away in a suburb of Madrid it is well worth searching out. It is small and very popular, so booking is recommended. The food is excellent, being based on what is fresh in the market at the time, so the menu changes weekly. The food is modern Spanish style, with a twist of Mexican (The proprietors wife is from Mexico). For English speaking customers there is no problem as the proprietor spent 5 years in America. The food is top quality and very reasonably priced, a genuine pleasure to visit. The best meal we had in Madrid!

title_review: Decent steak, not exceptional.  Overrated and pricy.
review_preview: I wanted to love this place based on other reviews and the recommendation of my hotel. But the steak was only decent, not exceptional. The service was friendly and fast. It was overpriced.TIP #1: they really undercook the steak here. I normally order my...
review_full: I wanted to love this place based on other reviews and the recommendation of my hotel. But the steak was only decent, not exceptional. The service was friendly and fast. It was overpriced. TIP #1: they really undercook the steak here. I normally order my steaks medium rare and I can handle red centers and blood. I ordered it medium here and it came out quite rare. If you like your steak actually medium (warm pink center) then I would order it well done here. TIP #2: The steaks come with NO sides whatsoever. You'll need to order any sides. Most of the sides I saw being brought out to other tables looked large, so two sides would probably suffice for two people. I had the smaller ribeye (350 g; Bifo Lomo or something like that) and it was decent tasting but nothing exceptional. Since it was from Argentina I expected it to be exceptional, but it really wasn't. Most of the 28-day-dry-aged ribeyes that I get in North America taste far better than this steak. The ribeye at this restaurant was only decent and needed a lot more marbling to be a good ribeye. The mixed salad (Mixta) was actually quite decent. I have a lot of trouble finding regular salads in Europe, i.e., those with lettuce and tomatoes. Normally European salads seem to contain pickled asparagus and other weird ingredients. Fine if you want to try something new, but what if you just want lettuce and tomato? The mixed salad here had lots of very fresh and tasty lettuce and tomatoes. The bread that came with it was decent. The service was quick and friendly. I might try this restaurant again. But it wasn't cheap and the steak was only decent, so I'd try other places before returning. Again, it was decent, but I left disappointed whereas I went in excited.

Lovely chilli popcorn provided for nibbles too.  Decor, atmosphere and staff all very very good

Espresso was as it is most places in Spain - not very good. Overall I was a bit disappointed...

title_review: don't overthink this one--just go and see for yourselves
review_preview: I just had lunch at Angelita after reading the TripAdvisor reviews of several places in Madrid I might have missed during this and previous trips here.  I was at the door at 1:30 when they opened; by 2:00 they were full, the staff all now...
review_full: I just had lunch at Angelita after reading the TripAdvisor reviews of several places in Madrid I might have missed during this and previous trips here. I was at the door at 1:30 when they opened; by 2:00 they were full, the staff all now at work at full speed. I sat at the bar, since I was alone, though they offered me a table if I wanted one. I chose small portions of the day's three specials: a single oyster on the half shell, perfect, fresh, great texture, like it had just been pulled from the sea; tomatoes from the family farm with little green pepper and anchovy adornments, which were the best tomatoes I think I've ever eaten, though one of the young owner brothers lamented that his parents thought these not the best of their crop this year; a rice dish with cod cheek chunks (which I brought most of home with me for breakfast tomorrow, since I wanted to save room for dessert); and a roasted vegetable dish that I can only describe by telling you to order it for sure. A new bartender named Luis arrived after my oyster and all things from there were magic: hyper-vigilant, Luis is entertaining to watch and has great personality and taste in wine pairings. I just let him pick, and am grateful that he did. Dessert was an unusual porcini mushroom mousse with fresh fruits and a thyme crumble, just wonderful with the cream sherry Luis said was meant to be had with it. So don't overthink this one--just go.

review_preview: Only good words I had heard about this place. Last Saturday we ended up getting there. Unfortunately we didn’t know you ought make a table reservation in advance, otherwise you won’t be served.Alternatively they told us we can go downstairs for a drink and...
review_full: Only good words I had heard about this place. Last Saturday we ended up getting there. Unfortunately we didn’t know you ought make a table reservation in advance, otherwise you won’t be served. Alternatively they told us we can go downstairs for a drink and some snacks if we fancy. I can only say it was fab!. Every single detail was cool, pleasant, cozy, warm... and the goods were outrageous. The staff members were great. Very kind, warm, polite... they really make you feel comfortable. Decoration was great. Wide sofas, poor lit room gives you intimacy, surrounded with spirits bottles everywhere and some vintage pictures. We ordered a fantastic red wine, I must recommend; ‘Yotuel’, although it’s name might evoke a joke, it was magnificent. 1). Tomato salad: nothing simpler than fresh and tasty tomato served on a plate. Some kosher salt, anchovies and jalapeños were aside just in case you wanted to mix them up. But plane tomato with some salt on top was pretty good. 2). Cheese sample board: around 9 different cheeses were presented to give them a try. Varieties such us: aged Gouda, Roquefort, Brie, Canarian cheese from Alegranza... although each has something unique, I would say Alegranza was one step over the rest. It was smoked and covered with truffle. Absolutely astonishing!. 3). Tacos: we tried pulled pork and langoustine taco. The first was warm, juicy, soft... very good one. The latter was cooler and you could feel avocado, coriander and the crunchiness of the langoustine. Wonderful! 4). Truffle mushrooms?: to be honest, I don’t recall the name of it. But I can still feel the fantastic mix of flavors in my mouth.  Basically consisted in a mushroom filled with a truffle sauce, and decorated with a fried quail egg. My goodness, what a wonderful bite!!! 5). Desserts: At this point we didn’t want eat any more, but somehow we decided to finish such a great dinner with some sweet. Chocolate coulant and black Forrest: the coulant is bizarre. The way the hot and cold merge in your mouth is a dream come true. The cake was performed differently. We could say it was their version of it. A sort of chocolate  Fudge with cream or truffle on top, and some berries ice cream aside. If you combine them you get a very interesting bite. Without any doubt, I must go. Do not hesitate for a second. I can’t wait to come again. Fabulous experience.

Classical and also some less familiar options are available. The prices are extremely reasonable as well. But beyond all that, the manager Alejo is - apart from being an amazing pizza cook - one of the friendliest people you could meet. He even gave me a special English-Spanish book to take home when he found out I was learning Spanish. I went three times during my stay to Pizzateca and would certainly go back again when I'm next in the city. Moral of the story: just GO to this place!

title_review: Great steak, lively atmosphere, great service.
review_preview: I ate here without a reservation on a  Friday night, which as a solo diner can end up with you being rushed to clear your table for two so two can eat. But not here, service was good, attentive and well paced - not too...
review_full: I ate here without a reservation on a Friday night, which as a solo diner can end up with you being rushed to clear your table for two so two can eat. But not here, service was good, attentive and well paced - not too rushed, not left feeling ignored. The place was probably three quarters full, so while I wasn't under pressure to eat and leave the atmosphere was lively with several couples and family groups, Spanish and foreign. I wasn't in the mood for a starter so went straight to the rib eye which was cooked as I liked it and very tender and tasty and the accompanying fries were really good also. The house red washed it down and was god value and a some ice cream and hot chocolate sauce finished thing of nicely.  If you want a change to Tapas then this place does really good steak with great service.

title_review: Some of the best pizza to be had in Madrid!
review_preview: The ingredients used here are very fresh, and, while not top-level, this is likely some of the best pizza to be had in Madrid!The owner is wonderful to interact with; he clearly takes great pride in his restaurant.  We ate here twice, and had...
review_full: The ingredients used here are very fresh, and, while not top-level, this is likely some of the best pizza to be had in Madrid! The owner is wonderful to interact with; he clearly takes great pride in his restaurant. We ate here twice, and had some of the more 'standard' options -- margherita, la diabola, and la rucolona. Unfortunately, there isn't a lot of turnover, so the pizza selection is often limited to what's been made that day, and it isn't right out of the oven. That being said, the owner lovingly rejuvenates the slices on demand, and they do taste quite good. It's worth noting that the square slices that are made to be sold by the slice are significantly better than the mini round pies you can get to go, as the latter tend to be thinner crust and a little soggy near the center of the pie.

title_review: For what it is, it's great!
review_preview: La Pizzateca is just a tiny hole-in-the-wall type of place, but the pizza is terrific.  They serve slices or whole pizzas to take away.  They also have a small counter with just 4 stools, and a cooler with soft drinks, waters, and beer.  But what...
review_full: La Pizzateca is just a tiny hole-in-the-wall type of place, but the pizza is terrific. They serve slices or whole pizzas to take away. They also have a small counter with just 4 stools, and a cooler with soft drinks, waters, and beer. But what makes it special is how good the pizza tastes. If they have the potato pizza available when you visit, try it. It's got very thinly sliced potatoes and is flavored with truffle oil. Delicious! We also tried the mushroom and the arugula-topped pizzas over the course of two visits. Everything we tried was great.

review_preview: I've been going to this place for over 3 years now and its now become a ritual of mine to pitch up there every Friday evening and have a solitary feast involving the Tutti Funghi pizza. (Tip: get the whole pizza to yourself, a slice...
review_full: I've been going to this place for over 3 years now and its now become a ritual of mine to pitch up there every Friday evening and have a solitary feast involving the Tutti Funghi pizza. (Tip: get the whole pizza to yourself, a slice will leave you drooling for more.)  There's genuinely nothing more satisfying than than mindlessly cruising social media on your iPhone whilst indulging in truffle-sauced pizza of a Friday eve. In fact by about Wednesday evening I start getting serious cravings for that creamy, cheesy topping. Unfortunately it's quite a distraction and my productivity at work decreases exponentially as the week goes on in anticipation.  On a serious note though the toppings are some of the most original and well-executed I've ever had. And as a plus the staff there are ALL super friendly and smiley and it's good vibes all around. Cant recommend enough.  In conclusion: YUM YUM

We enjoyed excellent gazpacho, served with wonderful bread and a seasoned butter. We each had a rib eye steak with charred baked potatoes. Some of the best steaks we have ever had and we come from Chicago where steak places crowd the restaurant scene. Our waitress was excellent and when we couldn't finish, she asked the kitchen if they could keep our leftovers until after our flamenco show. They readily agreed and we we enjoyed a second meal in our apartment the next night. So accommodating!

title_review: Good Food - but a thoughtless Chef spoiled our enjoyment!
review_preview: This was another restaurant we had reconnoitred near the excellent "Catalonia Las Cortes" hotel, and duly booked with a courteous and pleasant young lady. It looks well from the street, and the internal decor, while conservative, is pleasant. The heavy emphasis of the Menu is...
review_full: This was another restaurant we had reconnoitred near the excellent "Catalonia Las Cortes" hotel, and duly booked with a courteous and pleasant young lady. It looks well from the street, and the internal decor, while conservative, is pleasant. The heavy emphasis of the Menu is BEEF, and perhaps not surprisingly, there are very few "Whites" on the Winelist, but no "big deal" about that, we felt, as we contentedly settled-in to relax and enjoy ourselves, with only a handful of people around us. Our Server, as we look back on it, may have been a Trainee - unlike the very competent woman I had met when booking, she had no "Name Badge", and was not particularly self-assured. We ordered 1 Starter (to share) and a Main each, as well as some White (Rueda) & Red (Rioja) wine. So far, so good. We had barely sampled our Starter when our Server arrived at the table, somewhat agitated, asking "can I bring the meat?", to which our natural response (in words + hand signals), was "not yet - give us 10 minutes!". To our total amazement, she almost immediately landed-back bearing our Mains! We were practically speechless, and not surprisingly, our Server seemed suitably embarrassed. Between us all, we pushed aside the Starter so that our Mains could be pressed on us. To be fair, my Beef Milanese & my "Better Half's" Beef Tenderloin were both very good. But sadly, the quality of the food could not compensate for the grossly insensitive treatment we had just experienced - basically the Chef had forced the Mains on us to suit himself, not us! We eat out to savour and enjoy, not to have food stuffed down our throats at the whim of one thoughtless individual!! Anyway, having consumed the "force-fed" Mains, we requested "La Cuenta", declining an offer of Liqueurs. Our Server at this stage was apologetic, and we tried to convey to her that we did not blame her for what had happened - we asked could we speak to a "Jefe", but were told this was not possible. While not saying this to her, our feeling was that whoever was in charge lacked the "cojones" to face us! We paid our Bill of Euro 85-69 (not excessive, but perhaps at least the restaurant could have deducted the Starter charge?), without feeling inclined to add any gratuity. 'Shame - this restaurant has a basically good product, but surely customers shouldn't have their food rammed down their throats at the thoughtless whim of a Chef? And if you do "screw up", surely you should have the intestinal fortitude to face the aggrieved customer, and at least apologise?

review_preview: Greatly disappointed from our dining experience in La Cabaña, after high expectations.  Having come across it originally in passing the week previous, we liked the look of the it and based on the rave reviews from TripAdvisor, we agreed to return.  We felt the menu...
review_full: Greatly disappointed from our dining experience in La Cabaña, after high expectations. Having come across it originally in passing the week previous, we liked the look of the it and based on the rave reviews from TripAdvisor, we agreed to return. We felt the menu was a little pricey at first however, as our stay was nearly over in Madrid, we thought we'd try it nonetheless and agreed that we would all be willing to pay for a good quality, well-cooked steak. What we were served however, was far from impressive. Yes, they were cooked to our varying preferences and were enjoyable but for €17/18 for a steak alone- no sides included- I would've expected something significantly better and am confident I could produce something of similar calibre myself... For much, much cheaper; quite surprised to read other reviews citing them as "the best steak ever" - far from it, actually. Also worth noting is the extra 10% IVA (tax) charge on the total bill, something which seems to be excluded from the menu prices quite slyly. We were not impressed either by the €3.50 water bottle charge for the table (despite asking for just a glass), nor the extra €1.70 for bread - per piece, per person; adding this up for our party of five comes to €8.50 extra on the bill (excluding tax) which is extreme for something we never asked for and believed was complimentary, especially in a restaurant that pitches itself so 'up-market'.  If it were based on the steaks alone, I would rate about average although the main cause of our discontent arose from an issue with two of the main courses coming out as the wrong order. When asked upon serving if these were the correct dishes the waitress replied that they were however, after a few seconds examining the plates we could evidently see that they were not.  Upon clarifying this with the waitress, she took back the dishes and informed us that she will bring back the correct orders. After 10 minutes waiting, watching the rest of our party finish their steaks, the waitress reappeared with what appeared to be the correct order. It was not long though until we realised that in fact they were the same pieces of meat as the previous plates, topped with cheese and the other listed ingredients and cooked further in the oven. With no desire to eat over-cooked or re-heated meat, both plates were abandoned after a few bites. When asked to speak to a supervisor, we were told by the same waitress that she was his wife and we could explain the issue to her. She claimed that we ordered the incorrect main courses and explained this to another female colleague in Spanish (who was apparently another supervisor but turned out to be no help in the matter)- strange given the fact she failed to mention this when we raised the issue with her first- and suggested we were lying. She confronted us with a very aggressive and moody attitude and when requesting the bill, mentioning our desire to not be charged for the two main courses, she then made a snide comment about both plates being "half eaten". I have never encountered a waitress with such an attitude in any restaurant; the fact she claimed to be the wife of the supervisor says very little for the restaurant as a whole. No apology was received from any member of staff. At all. Would certainly not recommend visiting until they reevaluate their customer service.

title_review: Friendly service, fantastic wine & dessert and a very good steak!
review_preview: La Cabana Argentina was recommended to my uncle, aunty and I upon their stay at the Ritz hotel in Madrid. We visited this place a couple Mondays ago and I have to say it is one of the best steak meals I have had. Meat...
review_full: La Cabana Argentina was recommended to my uncle, aunty and I upon their stay at the Ritz hotel in Madrid. We visited this place a couple Mondays ago and I have to say it is one of the best steak meals I have had. Meat was cooked how we requested it and was served on a warm hot plate. The empanadas for starters were the BEST I have had in Spain, none of this re-fried/frozen rubbish, soft but crispy and full on flavor.  The mixed garden salad was very fresh and fantastic value, the bread served was also very nice and so were the sides to accompany the meat, although I thought the garlic fries were very powerful! Good selection of wines and dessert was fabulous. The bill was not very high either and in my opinion very good value for such high quality. I may be booking a table here for next week!

title_review: Fantastic service, food and atmosphere! What more do you need?
review_preview: After eating nothing but finger food whilst attending a 4 day conference in Madrid, we were in desperate need of some real food.A quick Google for ‘Steak houses Madrid’ and the top of the list was La Cabana, Argentinian restaurant.No wonder it was...
review_full: After eating nothing but finger food whilst attending a 4 day conference in Madrid, we were in desperate need of some real food. A quick Google for ‘Steak houses Madrid’ and the top of the list was La Cabana, Argentinian restaurant. No wonder it was top of the list, this place is fantastic. We arrived without a reservation, but it was a Wednesday night, the staff promptly arranged our table for 8. The staff were very welcoming and attentive even when it became busy. There’s a small bar area as you enter the restaurant which became quite busy as the World Cup was on and they were showing the Argentina vs Holland game. The atmosphere in the place was fantastic. We all ordered steaks some Fillet, some Ribeye, and they we all cooked to perfection, with the exception of the ‘Well Done’ one which wasn’t ‘Well Done’ enough, so they quickly took it back and killed it some more. The wine list was pretty good, I’m not a wine snob but apparently you must have a Malbec with your steak and there was plenty to choose from and very reasonably priced (for a restaurant). I would definitely recommend this restaurant and will probably visit again if I’m ever in Madrid again.

The dinner card, at a first look, seems quite simple and typically spanish (with some specialities from La Rioja Province) However, the food tasted excellent and it could not have been better. We were offered some aperitives along with the food we ordered. The starter I had was great and so was the menu and the dessert. What I liked the most is that there were very few tables in the restaurant, so not many people can dine here at the same time. Therefor, the atmosphere was quiet and it made you feel like you are dining at home. The interiors are like in a house and lit with candles, so you feel very comfortable. The two sisters that run the restaurant are very friendly and talkative and will come to the table to ask you if your enjoying your dinner. It was a different dinner experience, due to the small size and the "home-feeling" the place transmits to you. Would recommend it to couples.

title_review: Two sisters from Rioja with good food in a small restaurant experience
review_preview: This place is unusual and very pleasant. It is run by two sisters with strong links to Rioja-land.  One is the chef (who also takes lovely photos when she travels!) and the other is front of house. This is not your mass-market chain and is...
review_full: This place is unusual and very pleasant. It is run by two sisters with strong links to Rioja-land. One is the chef (who also takes lovely photos when she travels!) and the other is front of house. This is not your mass-market chain and is highly one-of-a-kind.  We turned up a touch early at 9:25pm and had to ring the doorbell because they do not open till 9:30. Inviting open dining room that does look like a family's front room. Probably only 8 tables and on this evening it was half Spanish and half foreigners though suspect normally more Spanish regulars.  Booking was easy by email or online.  The two ladies spoke good English and there are some menus also in English.  The food was good - though a touch confusing on what was 'meant' to be a starter or a main. All was consistently high quality. One of our party had snails, another superb asparagus and I shared excellent jamon with my wife. I had baby squid as a main course.  Wine list was short and geared around their house wine from Rioja. Full bodied and suited to the food.  The service was a delight and fun - like a mother checking on her extended family at the various tables. By the end you almost feel like old friends. Lovely for an evening out with friends or as a couple but maybe not if you plan for a very quiet meal to propose!?  No music though which is great and tables have very reasonable gaps between them.  Whole meal with three courses for four of us with two bottles came to 200E.

review_full: We made a reservation a few weeks ahead and were glad we did. The location is within walking distance of the Prado, down a small street. Once inside the restaurant is an oasis. The chef is also the host, and is very welcoming. His passion for the food comes through in his explanations. The food itself was delicious and not outrageously expensive.  The only strange thing was that several people came off the street and were turned back because they didn't have a reservation; however, over the two hours that we were there there were multiple tables free.

review_preview: We tried to have lunch here a couple of days ago and were fortunate to have a few more days in Madrid to book our lunch today. We loved the personal, attentive service and the love for simple, authentic food. We let the owner choose...
review_full: We tried to have lunch here a couple of days ago and were fortunate to have a few more days in Madrid to book our lunch today. We loved the personal, attentive service and the love for simple, authentic food. We let the owner choose our food and wine and everything was delicious. The sous vide leeks were probably the simplest but most delicious dish but nothing disappointed. We watched at least six groups being turned away so book if you can. Considering the quality of the food and the central location €74 for two was very reasonable for six tasting sized courses and matching wines. A perfect way to end a morning at Reina Sophia.

review_preview: We dined at Angelita and I couldn’t recommend it more. They source all their produce at a farm not far from Madrid. We had a beautiful tomato salad of a particular variety that was in season with just sea salt and olive oil and of...
review_full: We dined at Angelita and I couldn’t recommend it more. They source all their produce at a farm not far from Madrid. We had a beautiful tomato salad of a particular variety that was in season with just sea salt and olive oil and of course incredible bread. Then on to their ratatouille (pisto) that was fresh from their great produce and had the oxtail cannelloni for the main. Every dish came out at the right pace. Not too fast or slow. Also do not forget to ask for wine suggestions. This is a wine bar as well so they have everything by the glass. Each selection commended was superb. To top off the great food I would be remiss to not mention how professional and obviously proud of their product and how nice the staff was. What a terrific experience in Spain. Next trip I will most definitely return.

title_review: A perfect evening in all respects
review_preview: Hosting guests who've not been in madrid before, I went looking for new options and found this delightful restaurant.  Thank you TA!After an initial glitch with the reservations, it was all great!  Any good restaurant relies on a combination of front of house and...
review_full: Hosting guests who've not been in madrid before, I went looking for new options and found this delightful restaurant. Thank you TA! After an initial glitch with the reservations, it was all great! Any good restaurant relies on a combination of front of house and kitchen skills ... these sisters have it down pat!  The lovely lady in the dining room guided us through the menu (encouraging my friends to be more adventurous ... "why would you come to Madrid and order pasta") First two lovely hors d'oeuvres: a hake terrine, light as can be, and a porcion of one of the richest pates I've had the chance to sample in some time. At the hostess's suggestion we stuck with the house wine, a lovely crianza. For first courses we sampled the sardines, lovely, meaty and just briny enough; the duck confit with leeks (served instead with white asparagus and exceptional); a beautiful salad with perfectly cooked pulpo; and the croquettas, a bit cheesey for me, but my friends loved them. Entrees brought oxtails, so simple so rich in a gorgeous broth/gravy and topped with matchstick fried potatoes; the solomillo pork sirloin, served with an intense reduction of onions that had friends wiping the plate; and an order of the pasta with bacon and mushrooms (though she discouraged it, my buddy wanted pasta and he was quite happy with this take on carbonara).  There are 3 desserts on the menu so we sampled them all ... the rice pudding was more of a custard with less rice than anticipated; the apple/toffee confection was incredible and the chocolate torte was rich and dark We were among the last tables and the chef came out to chat with us ... such a treat! This is a restaurant that goes out of its way to make you feel welcome. you simply have to try it!

review_preview: We really enjoyed this restaurant. Very cozy and we felt as if we were in someone's house. We chose the following: asparagus in pastry lightly fried, sardines in a light tomato sauce with pistachios, cod in tomato sauce, and a house specialty, braised pork, braised...
review_full: We really enjoyed this restaurant. Very cozy and we felt as if we were in someone's house.  We chose the following: asparagus in pastry lightly fried, sardines in a light tomato sauce with pistachios, cod in tomato sauce, and a house specialty, braised pork, braised and slightly blackened. Dessert was a lovely dark chocolate raspberry cake as well as an apple mixture topped with a flavored whipped cream. Very satisfying meal and since we split the cod, pork, and dessert (split in the kitchen), we weren't stuffed. I had white wine, my husband red, and both were wonderful.  Arriving at 9ish made sure we were in the company of other tourists. We were all well received. The sister who is a chef came out to say hello and both sisters were so cute. Worth the visit for a simple but wonderful meal!

review_preview: The taxi driver had difficulty finding it and dropped us at the top of the road, after that we walked up and down and could not see it. I asked a local and was directed to a purple painted house with its door closed. We...
review_full: The taxi driver had difficulty finding it and dropped us at the top of the road, after that we walked up and down and could not see it. I asked a local and was directed to a purple painted house with its door closed. We had booked a tabled for 9.30 and got to the door at 9.25, after knocking the door was opened, we said we had a reservation for 9.30 and the lady said 'well its only 9.25!). We realised later that the place didn't open until 9.30. However, we were allowed in and were the only diners there until another group came in as we were leaving at 11.00. It is rather liked being in someone's home and after eating the two sisters engaged us in deep conversation about politics, the EU and other weighty matters for some considerable time. The food was good, albeit from a very short menu list, the sisters very pleasant and interesting and the experience was somewhat out of the ordinary which added variety to our stay in Madrid. We found the pricing to be a little on the high side considering that we did not have a dessert. I suggest you go there if you want some very nice home traditional cooking and a different kind of restaurant experience. Maybe avoid it if you have kids and/or want a more typical restaurant evening. We were glad we went.

review_preview: This was like visiting your favorite Spanish aunts who happen to be master chefs.  Cozy, homey atmosphere – because it’s literally a living room converted into a tiny restaurant.  The hospitality was beyond warm – it was familial.   All the dishes presented to us were...
review_full: This was like visiting your favorite Spanish aunts who happen to be master chefs. Cozy, homey atmosphere – because it’s literally a living room converted into a tiny restaurant. The hospitality was beyond warm – it was familial. All the dishes presented to us were delicious with truly homemade flavors. They included: for an amuse-bouche, minced fresh artichokes with olives; for appetizers, truffled cucumber soup, asparagus/mushroom omelette; for an entrée: chicken in saffron sauce accompanied by rice with currants; for dessert: baked spiced apples with spiced whipped cream. Chef Pilar didn’t hesitate to come up with other delicious choices for vegetarians/gluten-free members of our party. This restaurant gets top ratings on Trip Advisor and completely deserves them.

review_preview: Go to this restaurant. The food is incredible, the atmosphere is wonderful, the sisters are fantastic, the wine is great. This is a small restaurant run by two sisters for 19 years. It is a true experience- truly personal dining. The food is impeccable and...
review_full: Go to this restaurant. The food is incredible, the atmosphere is wonderful, the sisters are fantastic, the wine is great. This is a small restaurant run by two sisters for 19 years. It is a true experience- truly personal dining. The food is impeccable and the service is lovely and attentive. From starters (including the house made pate that was complimentary and was the best pate I have ever had) to entrees to dessert to wine everything was flawless. title_review: Nothing special for our celebration dinner.

review_full: We booked this restaurant for dinner to celebrate a milestone anniversary, based on the excellent reviews. Overall, we were very disappointed as our experience was not at all as expected.  We had hoped to take our time and enjoy our evening. We asked the owner who greeted us to choose our wines. We ordered half size appetizers, the octopus and the leeks. For our taste, the leeks were over cooked and over rated. For our mains we had the cod and the veal cannelloni. My veal cannelloni was so over cooked that it was basically just pasty mush. My husband ordered the creme brûlée for dessert, against my wishes as I was already unhappy with the meal. We were not surprised to be disappointed again by the runny, soupy brûlée.  Our meal felt rushed and unenjoyable.I was not even finished my white wine, while eating my first course when the waitress brought me my red wine to taste for my next course! What was the big hurry? I am surprised now at the great reviews this restaurant gets as certainly not deserved in our opinion. Not sure what happened? Would not recommend to others. One good comment; they did not charge us for the cannelloni as we complained and it was not eaten.

title_review: charming small restaurant, not for picky eaters
review_preview: Intimate and warm little restaurant run by two sisters who are very involved in your dining experience.  In general, this could be a good thing.  Food was good -- the oxtail and octopus salad both delicious.  Homemade pasta also delicious.  Did not love the bacalao...
review_full: Intimate and warm little restaurant run by two sisters who are very involved in your dining experience. In general, this could be a good thing. Food was good -- the oxtail and octopus salad both delicious. Homemade pasta also delicious. Did not love the bacalao with tomato sauce -- too fishy in taste for us, and we eat a lot of fish.  However, be careful in selecting this restaurant if you have young kids who are picky eaters or who may not enjoy the lengthy dining experience of a formal meal. Our experience was ruined by the overly obnoxious comments from the hostess who reprimanded us about our picky eater. On the plus side: they reluctantly agreed to make an existing menu item (fresh pasta with bacon and mushrooms) as plain pasta with nothing on it for our picky eater. We appreciated this gesture, and were willing to have him sit with no food rather than inconvenience the restaurant if it was too much trouble to make the plain pasta. (Which we explained in Spanish when we ordered. We recognized we were asking for a favor.). On the negative side: the hostess insulted our child, our parenting, and our unwillingness to force him to eat more diverse food at the restaurant several times. She justified these comments by saying she was like a grandmother, telling us what she thought. Our child was not loud, disruptive, rude, or in any way bothering any other diners in the small dining room, so her comments really were about her own personal feelings not about ensuring other diners in the restaurant had a nice time. Also when I did not care for the bacalao, so did not finish it, her comment was that Americans eat a lot of food ('always eat so much') so why wasn't I eating it. Essentially the insults-based service got old by the end of dinner. This would have been valuable information for us to know when booking the restaurant because I would not have chosen to make a reservation here had I known that they were not tolerant of kids. Come here as a couple for a romantic dinner, or for a more adult dining experience -- the interactions with the sisters provides a unique experience of the culture, and I'm sure the hostess would be more enjoyable then.

Thank you Isabelle and Pilar, we hope to return next year.

I definitely recommend this place if you want some great pizza, slices or whole, in Madrid. And it's in a great barrio too.

review_preview: My girlfriend and I visited La Pizzateca a week ago on our last evening in Madrid, after reading the many praising reviews. And we did not regret it! It's a pretty small take away restaurant, but there are a few spots where you can sit...
review_full: My girlfriend and I visited La Pizzateca a week ago on our last evening in Madrid, after reading the many praising reviews. And we did not regret it!  It's a pretty small take away restaurant, but there are a few spots where you can sit to eat your order. We both had a pizza with two different halfs, so we got to taste four different kinds of pizza; romana (with potatoes and truffle cream), napolitana (anchovies), roja (bolognese) and genovesa (pesto). All of these were very good, but the romana was absolutely amazing. I never had a pizza with potatoes before, but seriously, you should order this one!  Prices are fair, restaurant is nicely decorated and the owner is very friendly and dedicated to his job. Would definately recommend and will surely come back the next time I'm in Madrid.

title_review: Sin duda la mejor pizza en el centro!
review_preview: (english below!)¡10/10 LA PIZZATECA ES EPIC!Vengo aquí dos veces semanalmente ahora porque la pizza es TAN buena que no puedo evitarla x los findes. Empiezo cuando termino la semana de trabajo y vuelvo con una amiga casi siempre.Las pizzas llevan ingredientes muy...
review_full: (english below!) ¡10/10 LA PIZZATECA ES EPIC! Vengo aquí dos veces semanalmente ahora porque la pizza es TAN buena que no puedo evitarla x los findes. Empiezo cuando termino la semana de trabajo y vuelvo con una amiga casi siempre. Las pizzas llevan ingredientes muy frescos y bastantes deliciosos. Cada pizza, incluso los para llevar o comer en la barra en frente estan hechas con amor y atención. Nunca he pedido una porción, da igual de que parte de la bandeja era, que era mala. Si tienes el tiempo, déjate sentar y comer porque las pizzas hecho del momento son aún más riquísimas! Con una Alhambra para acompañarla, la pizza de La Pizzateca ha ganado la posición más alta y favorita en mi corazón de toda la capital (y tengo bastantes amigüitos Italianos que hacen una buena pizza, eh?). Los empleados son cariñosos y atentos, bilingües (por se a caso), y los jefes son majísimos! Vete prontísimo a La Pizzateca, ¡¡no lo vas a lamentar!! ==English== Disclaimer: I eat here twice a week now because my typical once a week has become insufficient!! La Pizzateca has become my favorite pizza joint in the entire capital region and I have quit a few Italian restaurant-owning friends! The pizza has fresh delicious ingredients, made fresh all day long, and I have yet to find anything comparable in tastiness and quality of ingredients and texture/crispiness etc etc. New Yorkers and lovers of that style of pizza (personally I'm a Sicilian guy, i like doughy thick pizza) will LOVE this stuff! I do too (call me a convert!).  With a great drinks menu, a slew of pizza and food choices, super kind and friendly (bilingual!) staff, and owners that care about their customers and employees bringing a much welcomed and rare family vibe to their business, I can't stress enough how much you need to go to La Pizzateca ASAP.  Forget papizza and these pop up 2€ tiny slice fast food chains and get yourself what your mouth and stomach deserve!

title_review: The Best Meal of Our Vacation
review_preview: My best friend and I toured Rome, Seville, Madrid, and Barcelona, and this meal was, by far, the best meal we ate in our three week European vacation. The restaurant is run by two adorable sisters, and when you enter, it feels like you are...
review_full: My best friend and I toured Rome, Seville, Madrid, and Barcelona, and this meal was, by far, the best meal we ate in our three week European vacation. The restaurant is run by two adorable sisters, and when you enter, it feels like you are dining in the sunroom of their home. One sister runs the front of the house while the other prepares the food as it's ordered. We ate a variety of dishes, including the ox-tail and the sweetbreads with leeks and fava beans. Amazing! But the standout dish was the fresh pasta with bacon and mushrooms. It was a simple dish, but the flavors were unbelievable. The pasta here was better than any pasta dish we ate in Rome. And the sisters are a delightful pair, indeed! They both seemed happy to learn I live in Atlanta, Georgia, because the chef is a fan of "Gone With the Wind." We talked for a bit after the meal was complete. I would recommend to anyone: don't leave Madrid without dining at this wonderful restaurant!

Complimentary pate as an amuse bouche (the most delicious pate de foie I have ever tasted). I had white asparagus with iberica ham to start followed by melt-in-the-mouth oxtail. The pudding of apples with caramel cream was a perfect ending. All washed down with house Riocha. The owners - two sisters - show a genuine interest in and for their guests. I wish there were more restaurants like this! Heart warming in every respect.

review_preview: We were recommended this restaurant by a local on a TA forum. We booked in for lunch and happened to be the only people dining, this was a shame, it lacked the atmosphere and ambiance from having other diners around you, though they were good...
review_full: We were recommended this restaurant by a local on a TA forum. We booked in for lunch and happened to be the only people dining, this was a shame, it lacked the atmosphere and ambiance from having other diners around you, though they were good enough to take our booking based on us being their only booking that day, apparently they have more in the evening, however sittings didn't start until 9:30pm and we had to be up early the next day. The restaurant was like you were entering some-ones house, this in intentional and adds to the character. The two sisters who run this place are very friendly and welcoming. Lots of chatter at our table. The food is decent home cooked food. We had their tasting menu. The pate was very good as were the chargrilled baby tomatoes. The cod was ok, cooked well, but quite fishy, soggy skin and a tomato sauce that doesn't come close to the one I cook myself at home. The pork with caramelised onions was ok, though the large medallion (few different sizes on the plate) was still raw in the middle. I assume this was intentional, though too underdone for my taste. My husband ate it and has lived to tell the tale. I probably wouldn't go back here, I love rustic home cooked food, but this could have been tastier. I would also recommend a visit in the evening - for more ambiance.

We went from a table of ten to a group of 20 which is the maximum the restaurant can take at one time and we all arrived at once which was a challenge for the restaurant as there are only two people in the kitchen and two serving but they managed magnificently. The restaurant is a little house and so it is just like eating in someone's home. Our group loved it and some of them wanted to go back the next night and were disappointed that it was closed. This included one of the vegetarians who was so pleased to have been especially catered for. This is not four star Michelin dining but you really do get the feeling that you are eating in Spain. The food is Riojan from the area where the sisters grew up and is the food of the countryside there. Isabella, the sister who is front of house is quite a character and put up with a lot from us that night but we all had a great evening and left the staff completely exhausted but still smiling.

The two sisters working there definitely were interactive, wanting to know where we were from, and to practice their English. This isn't a fancy restaurant, or a trendy restaurant. It's a family restaurant, with people who try hard, and do very well. Definitely a highlight on our visit.

review_preview: My husband & I made reservations (needed!) for our last night in Madrid and I am so glad we did!  This is a small, intimate restaurant run by two sisters who coddle their guests- trust whatever is recommended, including wine choices!  I had an amazing...
review_full: My husband & I made reservations (needed!) for our last night in Madrid and I am so glad we did! This is a small, intimate restaurant run by two sisters who coddle their guests- trust whatever is recommended, including wine choices! I had an amazing octopus salad as a starter- clean, fresh coins of octopus over wilted arugula- SO good I polished off the plate and would only give my spouse one bite! He started with a salad of mixed greens with dried venison, pine nuts & raisins. Also good! Then he got the oxtail- which was a stretch for us but turned out to be delightful! Super tender with a savory sauce- yum. I got pork with braised onions and loved it! Go with the older version of the house Rioja (older as in aged longer)- it was amazing! Then we had yummy coffee with roasted apples with a toffee cream for me and an unusual chocolate dessert for hubby, it was like chocolate toffee- really good! The entire meal was under E100! There is just one setting per night, it opens at 9:30, I suggest making reservations for that time and plan on a 3 hour dinner! It's small enough that we ended up chatting with 2 other tables, which was fun too!

review_preview: We are not used to eating as late as they do in Spain.  We had planned to go to another restaurant but it was not open.  We later discovered it opens at 9.00 p.m which is too late for me.  This place was open, looked...
review_full: We are not used to eating as late as they do in Spain. We had planned to go to another restaurant but it was not open. We later discovered it opens at 9.00 p.m which is too late for me. This place was open, looked nice and the menu suited us so we went in. We chose a pasta dish each, I had ravioli and my husband had cannelloni which we had with a salad and a glass of delicious red wine (Malbec). I realise this was an odd choice for an Argentinian restaurant but we wanted something light. Both dishes were nicely cooked and the service was good. The price was reasonable for a capital city, so a couple of days later we chose to eat there again. This time my husband had a steak with Roquefort sauce and I chose chicken with tomato and mozzarella. My husband's port was generous enough but mine was simply huge! I ate a good part and my husband helped me out but it was just too much. If like other places you can share I'd suggest you do with this and maybe order their roasted red peppers or a salad to go with it. Because we are so early it was very quiet and so it is difficult to comment on the atmosphere but it was nicely laid out and the service both times was very friendly and professional.

review_full: This place has actually produced one of our favorite pizzas of all time! We figured it may be touristy as it was located near some of the hotels and museums, but there were a handful of locals in there. We stopped in for dinner on a whim. The pizza was amazing...and we only had the vegetarian fare. If you are specifically expecting New York or Chicago style pizza, you are not going to find that. What you will find, though, are unique flavor combinations and very fresh pizzas. I believe we tried four slices: cheese, margherita, mushrooms/truffle oil, and potatoes (I've never had anything like the potato pizza). The crust, cheese, and sauces all tasted very fresh. What puts this place over the top is the owner. A very nice guy, if not a little quirky, and you can tell he is passionate about his craft. It shines through in his pizza. Be forewarned that the dining space is pretty cramped...but don't let that keep you from stopping by.

title_review: Probably the highlight of our trip

This is a restaurant for those who want to go somewhere a bit different and feel like they've dined where the locals go. Please try it - you'll be glad you did.

review_preview: The chef at Algarabia (one half of a sister duo who run the place) told us that they get a lot of custom from internet recommendations so I'm very happy to push the cause. From the outside it looks quite quiet but don't let that...
review_full: The chef at Algarabia (one half of a sister duo who run the place) told us that they get a lot of custom from internet recommendations so I'm very happy to push the cause.  From the outside it looks quite quiet but don't let that fool you - eating here is like being welcomed into someone's home and treated like an honored guest. The manageress was full of helpful suggestions and funny comments and makes you feel incredibly welcome, even when I accidentally broke a lamp bulb. We shared two starters and then had a main each which includes some amazing canapes and 'warm up' dishes, and with a couple of glasses of wine each it came to around E80 for dinner for two which felt like a great deal. The cooking is from the Rioja area with dishes as simple as sardines in oil through to a complex octopus stew and oxtail that melted in the mouth.  Honestly, give it a try, they deserve to be fully booked every night.

review_preview: Reading the reviews from other visitors (which we used as a base to book the restaurant) we expected quite a bit more. Pretty much everyone at the restaurant was foreign. No problem there but the lack of locals provided a first indication. The table we...
review_full: Reading the reviews from other visitors (which we used as a base to book the restaurant) we expected quite a bit more.  Pretty much everyone at the restaurant was foreign. No problem there but the lack of locals provided a first indication.  The table we were sat was bouncing. The owner's response was: "you can't lean your arms on the table". No fix here.  Wine menu came (had to wash my hands afterwards). Bottles that had not been updated in years. We asked for a 2001 reserve and were told that the only available was a 2008. "So, there must be a difference in price then? (I asked). Answ: No, years don't matter, the only thing that matters is the price".  The menu was brief, but quick and concise better than extensive and undeliverable, Right?. No. when the food came is was served on plates that had seen better days and well below average. €14 for a french omelet. 2 tiny new potatoes with my cod which should have been swimming in sauce but had less than butter on a toast.  Bathrooms ... clearly trying to be carbon neutral here. The light was on a timer that did not last more than 30 seconds. Keeping in mind that the lid had to be kept up with the left hand, right hand busy, light off ... pitch black adventure.  All in all .. an experience ruined by lack of professionalism, over-inflated ego and below average food.  I will certainly not forget the place but for the wrong reasons
