title_review: Best meal we had in Madrid
review_preview: We arrived at the restaurant and our reservation hadn't been recorded (sorry about that - I had actually booked it for the day after!) - however despite this the sisters couldn't have been more welcoming and accommodating. We had the croquetas for a starter which...
review_full: We arrived at the restaurant and our reservation hadn't been recorded (sorry about that - I had actually booked it for the day after!) - however despite this the sisters couldn't have been more welcoming and accommodating. We had the croquetas for a starter which are highly recommended! For the main I had oxtail, which was probably the silkiest, most tender meat I have ever had... My partner had the cod, which was dressed with a beautiful tomato sauce. Pilar (the chef) then came out to greet everyone which was a wonderful end to the meal. The price was entirely reasonable given the amazing experience we had. The entire time I felt like I was at a friend's house, the atmosphere in the whole room was very warm and positive. Would definitely go back. 10/10!!!

review_preview: A very classy restaurant for serious meat eaters. You see from the customers that its not the usual tourist that flies in to eat a steak. The clientele is business men and locals that appreciate the food. What is on the menu? Meat, meat and...
review_full: A very classy restaurant for serious meat eaters. You see from the customers that its not the usual tourist that flies in to eat a steak. The clientele is business men and locals that appreciate the food. What is on the menu? Meat, meat and more meat. Yes you can eat fish, but why should you? The meat is of supreme quality, and a 500g ribeye for 29,99€ in my eyes a bargain in such a restaurant. I like that the side dishes are very limited but again like the meat top quaility. The wine list is extensive and, well, also in my eyes expensive. Choose well or go with the recommendations of the waiter rather than just order. Seating is great as tables are not to close and the atmosphere is relaxing and not crammed. Good place to go when in Madrid, and of the beaten tourist track.

title_review: "Does exactly what it says on the tin!"
review_preview: This is my idea of a steak house, modern decor with that stripped back look but which still feels warm and welcoming, a friendly greeting as we walked in, and food served swiftly and without fuss. The mouth-watering strip steak was perfectly cooked, and generous...
review_full: This is my idea of a steak house, modern decor with that stripped back look but which still feels warm and welcoming, a friendly greeting as we walked in, and food served swiftly and without fuss. The mouth-watering strip steak was perfectly cooked, and generous enough at 300g, a tad short of 12oz, although 500g was available! I chose the fries with garlic and parsley to accompany it and was not disappointed as it was just what I expected, and plenty on the plate too. But just a note, sides are extra and my choice was dearer than most. However I could not fault the overall value for money at all. Will try and come back next year.

title_review: The best dining experience we ever have had!!!!
review_preview: If you don't eat here, you haven't tasted Spain.  My daughter and I were welcomed without a reservation (highly recommended).  We had an incredible evening.  Isabel and Pilar were impeccable hosts.  You will never have such a fine gastronomic experience combined with the most gracious,...
review_full: If you don't eat here, you haven't tasted Spain. My daughter and I were welcomed without a reservation (highly recommended). We had an incredible evening. Isabel and Pilar were impeccable hosts. You will never have such a fine gastronomic experience combined with the most gracious, down-home feel. A gourmet home-cooked meal amidst the bustle of the city. Not to be missed. The regional wine should be enjoyed, and take all of the lady's recommendations...none will disappoint! They are so welcoming and attentive. Thank you Pilar and Isabel, we hope to visit Madrid again just to visit you again. xo, Kathi and Danielle

Service was fine.

title_review: Too good to be true. This place deserves six stars, maybe seven.
review_preview: First, the "wine bar" upstairs: really a restaurant and wine bar. Whether you sit at the bar or take a table, the food is high quality and fun, the service is friendly and engaging, and the wine list and wine pairings are on a different...
review_full: First, the "wine bar" upstairs: really a restaurant and wine bar. Whether you sit at the bar or take a table, the food is high quality and fun, the service is friendly and engaging, and the wine list and wine pairings are on a different level altogether. I would recommend any winelover to just leave yourselves in the hands of the staff to try wines by the glass and half glass with different dishes. Not only will they give you some really high quality, fun pairings, they will also explain them to you and have no problem whatsoever adapting to personal tastes. And if there is one other area in which they excel it is cheeses: you must leave room for cheeses. Again, a fantastic offering, beautifully presented and explained.  Then the American Bar downstairs: one of Madrid's very top cocktail bars. Plenty of room to sit, perch or lean, and a fantastic combination of classic and updated cocktails of every kind, with some really fun presentations. Top recommendation - go to the bar and watch the boys in action. As good as anything you will see. And if you prefer your booze neat, you won't believe the collection of old bottles they have.  One of my favourite places anywhere in the world. Really outstanding.

They mostly interpret classic cocktails and award them a very own touch (e.g. Boulevardier with Mezcal). Then, the implementation is great as well. Drinks are well balanced and have a off the wall presentation and decoration.  Although the service was attentive and polite in the beginning, they seemed to be absolutely overwhelmed when the place started to become busy. Actually surprising because we noticed many waiters.  No one reacted to our wish to order again, so we decided to leave and go elsewhere. With a better organisation, this bar would be top notch.

Sweet Chili Chicken and Mushrooms with Black Truffle are my favourites. I usually just grab a slice or two while I'm in the area, so can't say anything about their whole pizzas, but I expect they are as good. Cheap, delicious, and with friendly staff, I recommend Pizzateca to friends frequently.

title_review: Best meal we had in Madrid!
review_preview: We stumbled across this restaurant whilst out walking in the day, popped in and they reserved us a table for that evening.Im late leaving my review but I have a friend going to Madrid next week and remembered this restaurant.  I have recommended it...
review_full: We stumbled across this restaurant whilst out walking in the day, popped in and they reserved us a table for that evening. Im late leaving my review but I have a friend going to Madrid next week and remembered this restaurant. I have recommended it to him. So I thought I had better write my review. Our waiter was lovely, he looked smart and knew the wine list and menu inside out. All of our meals were perfect, the wine he chose us was perfect and it was my birthday and a frriends bday and they did a suprise dessert for us which was a really nice touch. We thought the price of the meal was really reasonable, meals like that in London cost twice as much! I cant wait to go back!
